_header: Next that a tournament was tried
Title(s): ‘The justis betuix the tailyeour and sowtar’
Subjects: gallants, criticism/satire of; satire; jousts; ournaments
_description: ‘The justis betuix the tailyeour and sowtar’, by William Dunbar — nine 12-line tail-rhyme stanzas

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Syn till ane turnament fast þai hyitThat lang befoir in hell
                    wes cryit…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Befoir mahoun the dewill of hellSchiris trow It gif ȝe
                    list
CamMagPep2553.Note:
Prefixed by lines 1-12, 109-120 of 4164; 12-line tail-rhyme stanzas, aabccbddbeeb, here
                    laid out as 6-line stanzas.

Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.184-7.

Banna.First Lines:
Nixt that a turnament wes tryidThat lang befoir in hell wes
                    cryid…
Banna.Last Lines:
…befoir mahoun the air of hellNow trow thiss gif ȝe
                    List
Banna.Attributed Title:
Heir endis the iusting & the war sowtar &
                    tailȝouris maid be þe nobill poyet maister william dumbar (f.
                        112v)

Asloan.First Lines:
nixt at a tornament was tryitThat lang befor in hell was
                    cryit…
Asloan.Last Lines:
…Befor mahovne þe heir of hellSchirres trow It ȝif
                    ȝe list
